ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 111 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 111 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Though this exact class will never be offered again, if you have the chance to take any class with Deb, TAKE IT!!! She is one of the kindest and most creative and talented people I have ever met, and it was such a privilege to work with her.
Yes! Unfortunately, this class will never again exist, but it was an experience I wouldn't trade for anything.
This is a great class in which the students create a personal piece of theater. I would recommend it if they offer it again.

The Company & the Text: Portrait of a Lady was an incredible experience. It was an amazing opportunity to experience devised theater as a member of a company and produce a work that honored Henry James's Portrait of a Lady while giving voice to our experiences after reading and responding to it. The personal depth and collaborative nature of the show means that our class completely bonded throughout the experience and the work was uniquely ours.
